item.title: Access to Manor Farm, PRescott, GL52 9RE, 11th December
item.description:
We live at the end of a no through road, Manor Farm, Prescott GL52 9RE and have severla problems of our access. The road is covered in mud, the rpad is giving way and is unpassable. There are a number of huge potholes, trees are overhanging and are at risk of falling down, verges make it impossible to see roud corners. It is incredibly dangerous and needs looking at urgently. I would highlight our property is at THE END of the no through road, GL52 9RE and not at the start as the road is passable here.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gretton Road, Prescott, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes across the entire carriageway, 11th December
item.description:
There are multiple potholes across the entire carriageway, causing damage to vehicles. Many vehicles are taking to the grass verge to avoid them creating further damage. It is not possible to pass this point on the carriageway without slowing to 5 mph. In places the substrate is coming through.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Series of pot holes, 11th December
item.description:
Heading down the hill from the Air Ballon before the turn off for the new development on Lhs. Basically where a series of pot holes have been for the last 5 years. The same pot holes that you regularly badly repair. Please just renew this stretch of road once and for all. Your current strategy of re patching badly patched repairs with equally poor patches is something I would expect from a corrupt Mafia controlled organisation. How can you justify having “repairs” done soo badly soo often??
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4070, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large tree blocking Kidnappers Road, causing all traffic to go up and down Farm lane, which is struggling to cope as so narrow. Farm Lane not suitable for two way traffic. Please remove the tree and open up Kidnappers Lan as a matter of urgency., 11th December
item.description:
Kidnappers Road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Service trench road repair like a speed pump, 11th December
item.description:
The recent service trench road reinstatement is not level. Lots of cars are randomly breaking after driving over the bump and some appear to swerve as if they’ve driven over something unexpected.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Corinium Avenue, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog litter bag accumulation, 11th December
item.description:
The walkway that connects Alma road to back of lakeside school ending in Hatherley road has accumulated months of dog poop litter in bags and lots of empty drink cans between garden fences and footpath. This not only looks unsightly but presents a probable health hazard, it is particularly bad starting from the Alma road entrance

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alma Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
